child.pub-comments: "Within Bahnaric the West Bahnaric Division is not yet solidly established, but there are indications pointing in that direction" (Thomas 1973:139).

child.pub-comments: "[Some scholars] have recently questioned the assignment of Bahnar to North Bahnaric because of its lack of register contrast, suggesting that it be classed with South Bahnaric. But the lexicostatistical and geographical features strongly suggest North Bahnaric" (Thomas 1973:139-140).

child.pub-comments: Thomas does not explicitly call this group Palaungic, and in fact he doesn't provide any name for the subgroup comprised of these languages, but it is clear that he considers this a subgroup. In keeping with his names for the other divisions within Mon-Khmer, I have chosen Palaungic as the name for this group.
